item.title: Embracer Cancels Sale of Two Development Studios
item.description:
Embracer has announced that the proposed sales of 4A Games and Zen Studios have been canceled and will stay with the conglomerate after all. Embracer is a Swedish video game and media holding company that was first established in 2011, taking control of IPs of bygone publishers like THQ and JoWood. The company then grew in size, to the point that it became a public company in 2019. It then began purchasing and acquiring a number of studios throughout 2023, rapidly growing further, acquiring the likes of Metro developer 4A Games and Pinball developer Zen Studios.

The momentum of the Embracer Group's acquisitions came back to bite the conglomerate in a big way, due to the series of acquisitions making it infeasible to fund all the projects that it had under its umbrella. As such, several companies were shut down, many employees were laid off, and games were canceled. Several of these studios include the likes of Volition and Free Radical Design, with the Embracer Group restructuring itself after failing to acquire a multi-billion dollar deal with Saudi Arabia. Some of its acquired studios also had to be sold off, such as Saber Interactive for $247 million. However, it's been reported that Embracer will be retaining two development studios from this original sale, which are the aforementioned 4A Games and Zen Studios.

In a statement released by Embracer, it was announced that the pair of development studios will be staying with the conglomerate. 4A Games and Zen Studios were originally included in the $247 million dollar deal when Embracer was selling Saber Interactive to a group of private investors under Beacon Interactive, a new company formed by Saber co-founder Matthew Karch. Due to an early repayment and divestment of assets from Saber Interactive, it helped Embracer's cash flow, and allowed all commitments related to this transaction to be settled. "We are satisfied with the conclusion of this transaction and very glad to see the great teams and assets of 4A Games and Zen Studios remain within Embracer. They will be important building blocks in our continued journey," said Lars Wingefors, co-founder and CEO of Embracer.

4A Games and Zen Studios to Remain With Embracer Group

The CEO also congratulated Saber Interactive on Warhammer 40K: Space Marine 2 's successful launch, thanking Matthew Karch for his contributions over the years. He also wished the best of luck to both Karch and Saber in their new ventures at Beacon Interactive. As for 4A Games, it is currently working on two AAA titles that the company is "eager" to announce as well.

We are satisfied with the conclusion of this transaction and very glad to see the great teams and assets of 4A Games and Zen Studios remain within Embracer. They will be important building blocks in our continued journey.

Embracer is still restructuring itself after the fallout of its failed 2 billion dollar investment, having split into three separate publicly traded companies. While former Embracer acquired companies like Shiver Entertainment were bought by Nintendo, others like Alone in the Dark developer Pieces Interactive and Piranha Bytes were shuttered, with the latter being closed down as recently as June 2024.

item.title: Crisis Core Final Fantasy 7 Reunion: 5 Overpowered Builds
item.description:
Crisis Core: Final Fantasy 7 Reunion is a faithful remaster that brings the PSP classic to a new audience. While the visuals are vastly improved, the combat and the materia system received minor changes from the original, mostly involving bug fixing. That was for the best, as the materia and equipment system are what really make the game shine.

There's plenty of powerful materia and equipment combinations to be had, many of which can be obtained early in a playthrough. Endgame opens up these possibilities even more, leading to a number of overpowered builds.

5 The Best Early Game Build

How To Acquire Better Gear And Progress With Ease

Recommended Gear

Effect

Where to Find

  • Mog's Amulet
  • Wizard Bracelet

  • Guarantees rare drops/steals
  • Elemental immunity/absorb

  • M 4-4-3, Sector 7 Shop
  • M 4-4-3, Sector 7 Shop

Recommended Materia

Effect

Where to Find

  • Quake
  • HP Up (+/++)
  • Barrier/Mbarrier
  • Tier 3 Dark Elemental Spells
  • Tier 3 Elemental Blade Spells

  • High AOE magic damage
  • Large HP Boost
  • 50% Physical/Magic damage reduction
  • Elemental damage, poison, silence
  • Elemental damage for AP cost

  • M 4-2-6, Wutai Secret Shop
  • Fuse Master HP Up
  • Happy Turtle Shop, Loot or Materia fusion
  • Fuse or 20% Side mission completion reward
  • Materia fusion

This one isn't so much a build as a collection of things players can obtain early on to make easier progress. Most of the items and materia above can be obtained as early as chapter 2, and all of them can be won, bought, or fused before the end of chapter 3. Focus on side missions (essential missions listed above) and mastering an HP Up and elemental materia or two early on.

Make use of the materia fusion system to create higher tiers of mastered materia. Use this to fuse firaga, thundaga, or blizzaga early. Use poison or silence to fuse the dark versions, and inflict these status effects on enemies. Use physical materia to make the "Blade" versions so you can choose to spend AP instead of MP.

With these, HP Up, and Barrier, players should be able to push the harder 5-6 star side missions to get Mog's Amulet, Wizard Bracelet and Quake early. With all of these in hand before the end of chapter 3, players can be highly overpowered until mid-game.

4 Mid-Game Progression Build

Mastering Materia, Filling Out The DMW, Side Mission Clearing

Recommended Gear

Effect

Where to Find

  • Mog's Amulet
  • Wizard Bracelet
  • Brutal

  • Guarantees rare drops/steals
  • Elemental damage null/absorb
  • Break 9999 damage limit

  • M4-4-3, Sector 7 Shop
  • M4-4-3, Sector 7 Shop
  • M7-4-6, completion reward

Recommended Materia

Effect

Where to Find

  • Graviga
  • Darkness
  • Status Ward
  • Hell Elemental Spells
  • Smart Consumer
  • Dispel

  • Deals 50% of opponent HP as damage
  • High damage at the cost of HP
  • Nulls status effects of equipped Materia
  • Elemental damage, poison, silence, stop, death
  • Increased effect of consumables
  • Remove status buffs from opponent

  • Fuse Gravity + Dash
  • M8-4-6, completion reward
  • Materia fusion
  • M4-2-6, Wutai Secret Shop
  • Materia fusion
  • The Happy Turtle Shop

To get overpowered in the mid-game, the most essential item is the "Brutal" accessory, as it lets you deal up to 99,999 damage. To get it, you need to clear all the "Seeking Precious Items" side missions up to M7-4-6. This can be done as early as chapter 4 and will help with clearing all the missable missions before the chapter 7 point of no return.

Pairing Brutal with Graviga, which deals 50% of the opponent's HP as damage, is the earliest way to do enormous damage to bosses without stat boosting. Darkness will also let players break the damage cap, at the cost of HP. Pairing it with HP Up++ and Smart Consumer for boosted healing can help make this a non-issue.

This build also gives significant damage negation. Status Ward and a hell elemental spell give immunity to poison, silence, stop, and death. The Wizard Bracelet nullifies elemental damage and heals the player instead. Players might still want Barrier for extra physical damage reduction â€” and dispel to negate boss buffs.

3 Late Game Progression Build

Chapter 10 And Challenging Side Missions

Recommended Gear

Effect

Where to Find

  • Adamant Bangle
  • Ziedrich
  • Brutal
  • Soul of Thamasa

  • Break 9999 HP limit
  • ATK, VIT, MAG, SPR + 100, elemental damage -50%
  • Break 9999 damage limit
  • Null MP cost

  • M 7-3-6, completion reward
  • M9-5-6, chest loot
  • M7-4-6, completion reward
  • M 9-4-4, chest loot

Recommended Materia

Effect

Where to Find

  • Dualcast
  • Electrocute
  • Costly Punch
  • Curaga
  • Status Ward
  • Hell Elemental Spells

  • Casts equipped magic twice
  • High AOE lightning damage
  • High damage, ignores defences, costs HP
  • Heal (benefits from dualcast)
  • Nulls status effects of equipped Materia
  • Elemental damage, poison, silence, stop, death

  • M 9-4-1, chest loot
  • M 3-4-1, completion reward
  • M 9-5-1, steal from Mako Ifrit
  • Materia fusion, chest loot (various)
  • Materia fusion
  • M 4-2-6, Wutai Secret Shop

Players can acquire this build between chapters 7 and 10 and use it as a basis to acquire powerful endgame items like the Genji Set. With the Soul of Thamasa, Dualcast can be used without restraint. This means that high damage black magic spells like Electrocute and Tri-fire become viable without a huge MP pool. It also makes Curaga plus Dualcast a viable healing method.

Costly Punch ignores enemy defense stats and barrier buffs, and it doesn't rely on the attack stat for damage. It costs HP instead of AP, but with max HP at 99,999 (thanks to the Adamant Bangle), that can be mitigated with healing without leaving players open to 1-shot deaths.

To use this build to effectively clear late game content, players will also need to make extensive use of the materia fusion system to increase the stat bonuses granted by their materia, as well as the Ziedrich Accessory, focusing on MAG, VIT, SPR and HP.

2 The Minerva Slayer Build

Setting Up To Finish The Game In Style

Recommended Gear

Effect

Where to Find

  • Genji Armor
  • Genji Glove
  • Ziedrich
  • Genji Shield

  • Breaks max HP limit, endure and regen
  • Breaks max damage limit, critical effects
  • ATK, VIT, MAG, SPR + 100, elemental damage -50%
  • Wall, Elemental attack null, status effect null

  • Complete the DMW gallery
  • M 9-6-4, chest loot
  • M 9-5-6, chest loot
  • M 7-6-6, Magic Pot reward

Recommended Materia

Effect

Where to Find

  • Costly Punch
  • Mug
  • Aerial Drain
  • HP Up ++
  • SP Master
  • (Stat up as desired)

  • High damage, ignores defences, costs HP
  • Steal and damage enemies
  • High damage and HP drain
  • HP boost (up to 999%)
  • Use SP to boost all damage and damage reduction
  • (Desired = Max HP, Max VIT, Max SPR)

  • M 9-5-1, steal from Mako Ifrit
  • M 1-1-6, completion reward
  • M 4-2-6, Wutai Secret Shop
  • Materia fusion
  • M 9-6-5, completion reward
  • Materia fusion

Minerva is one of the toughest optional boss fights in the game. This build makes the fight a little smoother. Costly Punch can be swapped for any move that can deal 99,999 damage, but it's the easiest option, as other moves introduce AP or MP management to the fight.

Mug can be used once, at the start of the fight, to get a full stack of Phoenix Downs, which will be useful for restoring the auto-life status when Minerva's special, Judgement Arrow, removes it. Aerial Drain gives the player the option to keep up damage while healing, and SP master will boost the damage.

The most difficult part of the build is obtaining the Genji set items, then grinding materia fusion for maxed out stats. It's worth the effort, though; once Minerva is dead, nothing else in the first game cycle can offer a challenge.

1 Zack Fair, Hero of New Game+

One Overpowered Build To Rule Them All

Recommended Gear

Effect

Where to Find

  • Genji Helm
  • Genji Shield
  • Heike Soul
  • Zeidrich

  • MP/AP cost null, lLbra
  • Wall, Elemental attack null, status effect null
  • Breaks HP/MP/AP/damage limits, elemental attack null, Double Gil/item drops, Brigand's Gloves/Doc's Code/Shock effects, Smart Consumer/MP Master/Dualcast/Libra, always cursed
  • ATK, VIT, MAG, SPR + 100, elemental damage -50%

  • M 9-5-4, Network Shop Shade
  • M 7-6-6, Magic Pot reward
  • 100% Clear all missions
  • M 9-5-6, chest loot

Recommended Materia

Effect

Where to Find

  • Graviga
  • Darkness
  • Energy
  • High Jump
  • SP Master
  • SP Master

  • Deals 50% of opponent HP as damage
  • High damage at the cost of HP
  • Pierces, deals high damage multiple times
  • High physical damage after leaping in air
  • Use SP to boost all damage and damage reduction
  • Use SP to boost all damage and damage reduction

  • Fuse Gravity + Dash
  • M8-4-6, completion reward
  • Chest loot, completion reward (various)
  • M 6-5-6, completion reward
  • M 9-6-5, completion reward
  • M 9-6-5, completion reward

This build offers several key advantages that let players breeze through New Game+. It can hit for max damage against any enemy type (multiple times), it offers immunity from most damage types and significant reduction of any damage that does get through, and it negates or manages most resource costs.

Heike Soul does a lot of the heavy lifting for the build, especially the Dualcast effect, and is well worth the cost of permanent curse status. Players will also need to max their stats via materia fusion, but that isn't much of an issue at this stage in the game.

item.title: Best Strategy Games Set In Harsh Environments
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Different environments offer immersive settings for games beyond typical city or woodland backgrounds.
  • Original settings like Mutant Year Zero's post-apocalyptic world can provide a fresh gaming experience.
  • Games like Dune: Spice Wars offer immersive experiences by leveraging iconic settings, factions, and victory conditions.

Settings of all kinds can be perfectly suitable as they are, whether they be a tame fantastical woodland or a typical city. However, these environments can sometimes blur and become nothing more than a necessary background. Harsher environments, such as deserts or frozen wastelands, can offer a more immersive and tactile setting for players, grounding the overall experience.

World War 2, for example, can immediately settle a player into the experience when handled tastefully. However, WW2 as a setting can, more recently, feel a little stale due to how often it tends to be used. In the spirit of variety, these games all feature more original settings that are relatively far from reality.

6 Mutant Year Zero: Road To Eden

Adventuring In An Overgrown, Post-Human World

This story-driven, relatively linear RPG features strategic turn-based combat and a beautifully-realized post-apocalyptic setting. The game takes place on a "post-human Earth" inhabited by Mutants, who also double as the game's protagonists.

Throughout the game, players adventure across a variety of overgrown urban environments and woodlands, competing with a cast of challenging enemies and slowly discovering more about the game's post-apocalyptic world. Combat is turn-based and tactical, but players can use stealth mechanics to set up the perfect ambush beforehand, adding an extra layer of strategy to the experience.

5 Dawn Of War: Winter Assault

A Gritty, Snowy Expansion

Relic Entertainment's Dawn Of War is perhaps one of the studio's best games to date. Set in the deep and storied world of Warhammer 40,000 , Dawn Of War is a real-time strategy game that makes full use of its source material. The variety of factions to play and immersive campaigns, heightened by talented voice acting, are particular stand-outs.

Dawn Of War also features a squad-based system that offers a unique gameplay style, making it a distinctive experience for both beginners and veterans of the real-time strategy genre. Winter Assault was an expansion to Dawn Of War that added a variety of story missions set in the harsh and snowy environments of Lorn V, an ice world.

4 Darkest Dungeon

Battle Through Gothic Dungeons Against Lovecraftian Creatures

Darkest Dungeon is a tactical turn-based strategy game that revolves around managing a party of four heroes in a class-based RPG system, battling through a variety of unforgiving dungeons in a brutally unforgiving rogue-like structure. The game features a stark, Gothic, hand-drawn art-style that perfectly encapsulates its brutal gameplay, painting a vivid picture of its harsh world.

The ever-dwindling light of the torch must constantly be cared for, as to not fall into complete, panic-inducing darkness, and keeping the dungeon illuminated is just one of the many things that players must manage. Stress, environmental hazards, and the vicious, Lovecraft-inspired enemies themselves bring a constant sense of dread to the overall experience.

3 Wasteland 3

A Tactical RPG In A Frozen Wasteland

Desperation, violence, and strategic combat are plentiful in the post-apocalyptic, frozen-over world of Wasteland 3 , a deep CRPG with a variety of endings. The dark, chilly environments are dense with atmosphere, offering up a beautifully realized depiction of a frozen Colorado.

Each violent encounter in Wasteland 3's harsh, icy world is played out with tactical turn-based combat. The squad-based mechanics, alternate endings, and colorful characters are all great strengths of Wasteland 3 , but its evocative, freezing Colorado setting is one of its most prominent features.

2 Kenshi

A Sandbox RPG With Strategic Combat & An Open World

Complete and utter freedom is Kenshi's greatest promise, one that it fulfills by plonking players down in the middle of a harsh and unforgiving desert wasteland with little to no guidance. Players are fragile in Kenshi , and anything can kill them in its take-no-prisoners world. Actually, that's somewhat inaccurate, as players can and will often be taken prisoner and enslaved by one of the game's most infamous factions.

Players can approach Kenshi from all manner of directions, and the game allows players to explore and interact with its world freely. Base-building, stealth, trading, and simply exploring are all par for the course in Kenshi . The strategy comes along with the game's squad-based mechanics and real-time-with-pause combat in which players micromanage multiple units at a time in encounters that can vary drastically in scale.

1 Dune: Spice Wars

A Real-Time 4X Strategy Game In Frank Herbert's Iconic Universe

Taking place on the sparkling, melange-dusted sands of Arrakis (otherwise known as Dune), Dune: Spice Wars is a real-time 4X strategy game that makes the best of its evocative science-fiction setting. From the variety of playable factions, each featuring their own thematic strengths and weaknesses, to the inclusion of spice harvesting and the iconic sandworms, Dune: Spice Wars is a tremendously immersive experience that's perfect for fans of the classic novels.

The multitude of victory conditions and myriad paths to each of them is one of Dune: Spice Wars' most notable features. Meanwhile, the brilliant faction variety and the diversity of gameplay options within each of their tool-sets gives the game its replay value. It's no surprise that Dune: Spice Wars is, like the "spice melange" of its source material, massively addictive, especially once players have learned its intricacies. Dune: Spice Wars was developed by Shiro Games, developers of the Norse-inspired strategy game, Northgard. Their aptitude for design is on full display here.

After wrapping up the one-day Safari Sprint tournament, Monopoly GO has announced a two-day leaderboard tournament: Jungle Rumble. It will kick off on Sep 13 and will run until Sep 15.

item.title: Fortnite: How to Get the Black Cat Skin
item.description:
Marvel's Black Cat slinks her way to Fortnite , bringing along her tricks of burglary and good heart to become yet another Marvel skin in Fortnite . Felicia Hardy is an iconic character rooted in the Spider-Man mythos, and with the Black Cat skin in Fortnite , this Marvel character can shine against the rest thanks to her charm.

The day has arrived, and players can finally open their V-Buck wallets to claim their purchase of Black Cat. That is unless she uses her sleight of hand to steal them first. The infamous cat burglar has been a highly anticipated release in Fortnite , and she joins the colorful and expansive roster of all Spider-Verse characters in Fortnite to bring Spider-Man's hectic New York battles, friendships, and romances to life.

How to Get Black Cat in Fortnite

The Black Cat outfit in Fortnite was released on Friday, September 13, 8 PM ET in the Fortnite Item Shop. Players can either purchase the skin separately or as a bundle from the Fortnite Shop web browser: Black Cat Bundle, or, by navigating to the in-game Item Shop and purchasing the Black Cat outfit for 1,500 V-Bucks . Alternatively, players can acquire the Black Cat Bundle for 2,300 V-Bucks, which is only 800 V-Bucks more, and comes with her full set of cosmetics that can be found below. Players might want to hurry, as Black Cat leaves the Fortnite Item Shop on September 20, 8 PM ET.

All Black Cat Cosmetics in Fortnite

Item Name

Item Type

Item Price

Black Cat

Outfit

1,500 V-Bucks

Black Cat

LEGO Outfit

Comes with Black Cat

Cat's Pack

Back Bling

Comes with Black Cat

Bad Luck Claws

Pickaxe

800 V-Bucks

Cat's Tracks

Wrap

500 V-Bucks

The Black Cat

Guitar

800 V-Bucks

The Black Cat collab from Marvel x Fortnite comes with 6 items, with the most interesting of the bunch being the outfit of the expert thief and skilled martial artist herself, Black Cat. Black Cat's iconic fascination with Spider-Man is hard to understate, and it seems that her interest in the Web-Head is more than just that of a cat with a playful ball of yarn. The outfit comes with a mask on and a mask off style, and it completes the stellar look of Fortnite 's own art style with Marvel's characters, providing the game with yet another great skin from the Marvel roster.

Players can get Black Cat for 1,500 V-Bucks and the rest of her cosmetics for a total of 3,600 V-Bucks. However, they can receive all of her items, skin included, if they purchase the Black Cat Bundle for 2,300 V-Bucks.
